title: Encosta do Sobral 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)
description: This wine is definitely on the tropical-fruit spectrum of Sauvignon Blanc flavors. So apricot and white-nectarine flavors are right up front in this ripe wine. It's all fruit, with a tangy edge of citrus to give freshness. Drink now.

title: Fowles Wine 2014 Farm to Table Shiraz (Victoria)
description: A simple, fruity number, this wine exudes pleasing stewed rhubarb, plums, raspberries, flowers and black pepper notes, but there's also some heat and oak that's a little intrusive. The palate is plush and round, with savory, sandy tannins, crunchy acidity and a bitter oak element on the finish.

title: Glenora 2017 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: Aromas of citrus rind, white blossoms and peach skin make for an enjoyably fresh nose. The palate is rounded in feel, with an integrated line of acidity that boasts creamy citrus and coconut flavors.

title: I Capitani 2015 Campi Taurasini Jumara Aglianico (Irpinia)
description: This Aglianico opens with aromas of vanilla, dark-skinned fruit and camphor. The straightforward palate offers black plum jam, mocha and star anise alongside round tannins. Drink soon.

title: Joseph Mellot 2017 Clos du Pressoir  (Menetou-Salon)
description: A wholly owned Mellot walled vineyard in this small region west of Sancerre is the source of this crisp wine. It is light and bright with mineral texture while not losing fruitiness. Drink this refreshing wine now.

title: Leonard Kreusch 2017 Piesporter Goldtröpfchen Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: This wine is forward in aromas of guava and pink grapefruit, with a backdrop of smoky slate. Medium-sweet in style yet light in body. Zesty, piercing acidity freshens a long, mineral finish. It's easy-drinking wine to enjoy now–2022.

title: Lük 2016 Havlin Vineyard Upper Slope Gamay Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is rather tight and tannic for a grape that is more often fruity and forward. Flavors of blueberries and graphite come up, with hints of stem. The tannins retain some earthy astringency.

title: MAN Family Wines NV Méthode Cap Classique Brut Sparkling (Coastal Region)
description: Medium-intense scents of apple pie filling, creamed orange and grilled pineapple fill the nose of this enticing sparkler. The palate shows a bit more restraint, as flavors of lime peel, melon rind and straw are partnered with bright acidity and ample carbonation to balance and lift.

title: Maryhill 2015 Proprietor's Reserve Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Raspberry jam, slightly candied fruit and barrel spice aromas are followed by ripe, luscious fruit flavors. The tannins bring a bit of grit on an otherwise enjoyable offering.

title: Mathew Bruno 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Fleshy and full-bodied, this 100% varietal white offers notions of sweet peach, baked pineapple, biscuit and honeycomb. The texture is thick and viscous.

title: Merriam 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Whole-berry pressed, the estate fruit is farmed organically for this wine, which is a rich and relatively thick expression of candied strawberry and watermelon Jolly Rancher. It refreshes through the finish.

title: Miles From Nowhere 2017 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)
description: This wine is ultra extroverted and bursting with aromas of green pepper, grass, lemon and white spice. On the palate is a mighty lick of acidity and a slightly chalky texture.

title: Nardone 2011  Taurasi
description: Prune, underbrush, scorched earth and cocoa aromas lead the nose, along with a slight whiff of barnyard. On the evolved palate, fine-grained but rather fleeting tannins support dried black cherry, raisin and a hint of baking spice alongside the warmth of evident alcohol. Drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit.

title: Pascal Jolivet 2016 Bondenotte  (Sancerre)
description: Named after a parcel of old vines in the village of Bué, this wine has an earthy character. A yeasty edge contrasts with the red-cherry fruits. The wine could do with a few months more, so drink from 2019.

title: Philippe Prié NV Brut Tradition  (Champagne)
description: An immediately drinkable wine, this is crisp and bright with green fruits, apples and final acidity. It has a light mousse and a good lift at the end. Drink now.

title: Quinta da Plansel 2017 Plansel Selecta Red (Alentejano)
description: This open fruity blend is rich and full bodied. It exudes warm southern sun and ripe grapes. Happily, they are balanced with gentle tannins as well as acidity. Drink the wine now.

title: Raphael 2017 Pinot Grigio (New York)
description: Light rose gold in the glass, this wine offers a fresh orchard-fruit aroma, with a riper notion of peach underscored by white blossoms. The palate is less flourished, yet still boasts rounded apple and pear flavors that are balanced by a shot of tangerine acidity.

title: Régine Baron NV Cuvée Perle Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: Pale in color, fresh while soft, this is an attractive, red-fruit -lavored Champagne. A shot of crisp acidity balances the ripe fruit, giving a wine that is ready to drink.

title: Rivata 2014  Barbaresco
description: The shy nose eventually reveals baking spice and dark-skinned fruit. On the linear palate, close-grained astringent tannins accompany sour cherry and clove. Drink after 2022.

title: Robert Hall 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of gravelly earth, dark black cherry, wet wood and smoke show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is also very earthy, although a tad weak, with smoke-laced black currant and peppery spices.
